dcterms:creator: Tatiana Kachkovskaia
Daniil Kocharov
Pavel Skrelin
Nina Volskaya
dcterms:description: CoRuSS is a corpus based on connected communicative speech recorded from 60 native Russian speakers, providing detailed prosodic annotation of spontaneous conversational speech. It contains 30 hours of high-quality recorded spontaneous Russian speech, with half transcribed and prosodically labeled.
dcterms:title: CoRuSS (Corpus of Russian Spontaneous Speech)

dcterms:creator: N. Bogdanova-Beglarian
G. Martynenko
T. Sherstinova
dcterms:description: The ORD corpus contains more than 1000 hours of everyday speech collected by recording the whole day speech of over 100 participants. It has partial annotation and transcription.
dcterms:title: ORD (One Day of Speech) corpus

dcterms:creator: A. A. Kibrik
A. Podlesskaya
dcterms:description: PrACS-Russ is a corpus containing over 4 hours of monologue speech with limited prosodic annotation based on two types of tones—rise and fall—and their combinations, as well as detailed labeling of various speech phenomena.
dcterms:title: PrACS-Russ (Prosodically Annotated Corpus of Spoken Russian)

dcterms:creator: P. Skrelin
N. Volskaya
D. Kocharov
K. Evgrafova
O. Glotova
V. Evdokimova
dcterms:description: CORPRES is a corpus of Russian professionally read speech containing over 30 hours of speech recorded in a professional studio, segmented and annotated on orthographic, phonetic, and prosodic levels.
dcterms:title: CORPRES (Corpus of Professionally Read Speech)

dcterms:creator: O. Krivnova
dcterms:description: RuSpeech is a corpus containing about 50 hours of transcribed recordings produced by 220 speakers, allowing for training acoustic models for ASR or TTS.
dcterms:title: RuSpeech
